com.u.tallerify.utils

Class FrescoImageController.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.u.tallerify.utils.FrescoImageController.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    FrescoImageController

    public static class FrescoImageController.Builder
extends java.lang.Object
    Builder class to withProvider an immutable FrescoController

      FrescoImageController.Builder load(android.net.Uri uri)
      Set Uri from where the image will be loaded
      FrescoImageController.Builder localThumbnailPreview(boolean should)
      Show local thumbnail if present in the exif data Default: false Fresco limitation: This option is supported only for local URIs, and only for images in the JPEG format.
      FrescoImageController.Builder mediaVariations(MediaVariations mediaVariations)
      When having multiple uris that reference a single image but with different dimensions, you can set a media variations for all the variants that if you have already cached a different sized image (of the same variant), when loading a new one instead of downloading it, it will just retrieve the other and onRender it for the new size.
      FrescoImageController.Builder noCache()
      Dont cache the image.
      FrescoImageController.Builder noDiskCache()
      Dont cache the image in disk.
      FrescoImageController.Builder noMemoryCache()
      Dont cache the image in memory By default all images are cached
      FrescoImageController.Builder postprocessor(Postprocessor postprocessor)
      Since there are more than one postprocessor and processing methods (see BasePostprocessor and BaseRepeatedPostprocessor) and there are three different processing methods, you should feed the builder with the postprocessor instance already created (instead of us defining a particular method and class for you to process the data) Note: DO NOT override more than one of the bitmap processing methods, this WILL lead to undesired behaviours and is prone to errors Note: Fresco may (in a future, but currently it doesnt) support postprocessing on animations.
      FrescoImageController.Builder priority(Priority priority)
      Priority for the rendering of the image (for higher priorities, it will be picked faster from the queue for rendering)
      FrescoImageController.Builder progressiveRendering(boolean should)
      Load the image while its rendering, this is useful if you want to show previews while its rendering Default: false
      FrescoImageController.Builder resize(int width, int height)
      Resize the image before showing it.
      FrescoImageController.Builder rotationOptions(RotationOptions rotationOptions)
      Describes how the image should be rotated, this happens pre decoding! Works for JPEG only.
      FrescoImageController.Builder tapToRetry(boolean should)
      Tap on the image to retry loading it Default: False

      • resize

        public FrescoImageController.Builder resize(int width,
                                            int height)
        Resize the image before showing it. Of course resize != scale. For scaling just use the layout_width / layout_height of the view. If you need a particular mode you can use the hierarchy. Note: Currently fresco doesnt support png resizing. So take into account that if you will implement this in a place with possible .png images (like local user files) you wont have all images resized. This can lead to problems, eg if you have a jpg and a png image of 16:9 and you resize to 1:1, you will only resize the squared one. A possible solution for this, but please use it carefully is to use a postprocessor that resizes the bitmap if its Uri is a .png, but be careful it can make the cache useless
        Parameters:
        width - dest to resize
        height - dest to resize
        Returns:
        Builder

      • noCache

        public FrescoImageController.Builder noCache()
        Dont cache the image. By default all images are cached
        Returns:
        Builder

      • noDiskCache

        public FrescoImageController.Builder noDiskCache()
        Dont cache the image in disk. By default all images are cached
        Returns:
        Builder

      • noMemoryCache

        public FrescoImageController.Builder noMemoryCache()
        Dont cache the image in memory By default all images are cached
        Returns:
        Builder

      • cacheChoice

        public FrescoImageController.Builder cacheChoice(ImageRequest.CacheChoice cacheChoice)
        Set the choice of cache. By default Fresco can store images in a lowres cache and a default. If you know your image is tiny enough, you can set the tiny cache to make fresco more performant.
        Returns:
        Builder

      • mediaVariations

        public FrescoImageController.Builder mediaVariations(MediaVariations mediaVariations)
        When having multiple uris that reference a single image but with different dimensions, you can set a media variations for all the variants that if you have already cached a different sized image (of the same variant), when loading a new one instead of downloading it, it will just retrieve the other and onRender it for the new size.
        Returns:
        Builder

      • priority

        public FrescoImageController.Builder priority(Priority priority)
        Priority for the rendering of the image (for higher priorities, it will be picked faster from the queue for rendering)
        Returns:
        Builder

      • tapToRetry

        public FrescoImageController.Builder tapToRetry(boolean should)
        Tap on the image to retry loading it Default: False
        Parameters:
        should - enable tap to retry
        Returns:
        Builder

      • autoPlayAnimations

        public FrescoImageController.Builder autoPlayAnimations(boolean autoPlayAnimations)
        Start automatically the animations. This is the same as attaching a listener, checking nullability of animatable and doing animatable.start();
        Returns:
        Builder

      • progressiveRendering

        public FrescoImageController.Builder progressiveRendering(boolean should)
        Load the image while its rendering, this is useful if you want to show previews while its rendering Default: false
        Parameters:
        should - be enabled
        Returns:
        Builder

      • localThumbnailPreview

        public FrescoImageController.Builder localThumbnailPreview(boolean should)
        Show local thumbnail if present in the exif data Default: false Fresco limitation: This option is supported only for local URIs, and only for images in the JPEG format.
        Parameters:
        should - show it
        Returns:
        builder

      • decodeOptions

        public FrescoImageController.Builder decodeOptions(ImageDecodeOptions options)
        Use a custom decode options. Create it with ImageDecodeOptionsBuilder. Beware since this handles internal state information. Use at your own risk if needed.
        Parameters:
        options - for image decoding
        Returns:
        Builder

      • rotationOptions

        public FrescoImageController.Builder rotationOptions(RotationOptions rotationOptions)
        Describes how the image should be rotated, this happens pre decoding! Works for JPEG only.
        Returns:
        Builder

      • postprocessor

        public FrescoImageController.Builder postprocessor(Postprocessor postprocessor)
        Since there are more than one postprocessor and processing methods (see BasePostprocessor and BaseRepeatedPostprocessor) and there are three different processing methods, you should feed the builder with the postprocessor instance already created (instead of us defining a particular method and class for you to process the data) Note: DO NOT override more than one of the bitmap processing methods, this WILL lead to undesired behaviours and is prone to errors Note: Fresco may (in a future, but currently it doesnt) support postprocessing on animations.
        Parameters:
        postprocessor - instance for images
        Returns:
        Builder

      • into

        public FrescoImageController into(DraweeView view)
        Attach to a view. Note this will handle the loading of the uri. There MUST be (Mandatory) an existent Uri from where to load the image. You can save the returned instance to retreive the data you have used or to explicitly call the callbacks
        Parameters:
        view - to attach the desired args
        Returns:
        Controller
